page.title: 11KINGS BUILDINGS EDINBURGH
page.content: When we visited the King's Buildings, which are part of{Edinburgh {University,}we were told that there were approximately 20 departments. The principal areas of research are information technology, chemistry, biology and physics. The non-university departments are a block which is associated with the British Geological Survey, owned by one of the research councils. There is also an animal breeding unit and the Royal Observatory. The total number of people employed is around 500. Of these, about 250 are academic staff. The total number of students is about 2500. British students make up about 95% of the students. The rest are from overseas. 30 or 40% are female. There are also about 700 post graduate students.
